name: Black Chamber 1919
description: One of the first long books I remember reading is 'The Code Breakers' by David Kahn. I always found the idea of secret symbols, codes, and code breaking interesting. As a result, I’ve always found the big signals intelligence organizations in America—the NSA, the NRO, and the NGA—interesting too. As I got older and learned more about them, I’ve also been continually irritated by their incompetence and their constant overreaching. The NSA, in particular, is to my mind the perfect example of the dangers of running overwhelming bureaucracy together with compartmentalized secrecy. This drawing is something like a record of me thinking about the structure and history of the NSA.
